foundit66

A new study commissioned by the New York City Council has found that almost one-third of New York's homeless youth identify as lesbian, gay, bisexual or transgender, confirming the findings of the National Gay and Lesbian Task Force's groundbreaking national study, LGBT Youth: An Epidemic of Homelessness, released last December.
 ....
 The study by the Empire State Coalition of Youth and Family Services closely mirrors the findings of the Task Force/National Coalition for the Homeless report, which found that between 20 and 40 percent of homeless youth across the nation are LGBT. Both studies highlight the particular vulnerability of LGBT youth, who are too often targeted for ostracism and abuse not only at home and school, but also in the shelters where they might hope to find sanctuary.
 
 While the recent New York City study draws our attention to the terrible plight of LGBT youth, media coverage yesterday made no reference to the particular challenges and threats faced by transgender youth if they land on the streets. The Task Force report notes that transgender homeless youth are more likely to face discrimination in the traditional shelter system, more likely to find it difficult to obtain and maintain meaningful employment, and are subsequently far more likely to engage in survival sex or other risky behaviors.
 
 Foreman added, "These findings confirm a tremendous need for LGBT-affirming programs - whether they be shelters, transitional housing or services. Research has found that fully one-quarter of homeless gay youth are forced to leave home when they come out. Where are these young people going to go? How are we as a community taking responsibility for their safety and well-being?"
 http://www.thetaskforce.org/press/releases/pr_121907
 
 But as "some" people will tell you, this is really about "acceptance" and not wanting to hear some people tell us they think gay sex is a sin.
 Obviously, since left-handed people don't address issues like lefties being homeless, we shouldn't bring up the issue of gays who are homeless because they are ostracized. emoticon_rolleyes

 It is truly painful how many ways that is wrong. 
 Geraldo OK.
 
 Prior to CRIPA in 1980, there was some shocking abuses in institutions (and the mental institutions were only part of these.) In Willowbrook (which housed the mentally retarded), there was some unethical research occurring, in addition to deplorable conditions. This mandated improvement, not release. The involuntary hold is now rational and fully maintains a balance between civil rights and public safety. The vast majority of (psychiatrically) mentally ill do not need institutionalization anyway due to the improvement in care. They do need out-patient services and these are lacking all over the country for many reasons, none of which has to do with CRIPA. In patient beds are also scarce. Mental patients live in ERs for days becuase of this. 
 
 I am blaming no party. It is another symptom of our broken health care system.

Many of the homeless were former military. Why does this country hate its veterans do you suppose?

 
 I don't think it's the country at all. It's GOP indifference to anyone who isn't wealthy. I agree if there were better programs in general directed towards enabling the homeless to find and keep jobs, then gay youth would suffer less at the hands of the churches. Still, we can't expect the historical animosity of Christian churches against gay people to be wiped out overnight, and so I think that irrespective of the damage the GOP has done to social services in the US, and irrespective of the Democrats' failure to stop them or do much better, the gay community needs to take the problem more seriously.
 
 It's true as someone pointed out that there ARE gay organisations dedicated to dealing with homeless gay youth cast out by their Christian families, but from my experience of Atlanta, they aren't a priority -- the organisations are usually small and without stable or adequate funding, able to address only a small part of the problem, helping a few tens or hundreds out of the thousands or tens of thousands who could benefit. 
 
 I honestly think it needs the same sort of attention gays gave to HIV, and so gay groups ought make homeless services a much higher priority. Gay youth are our future, and I think if we are a responsible community, we need to pay it some heed.
 
 I think one of the sad problems here is the fear of the Christian accusation of "recruitment", the slander that gay adults prey on youth. That makes it more difficult for the gay community to address the issue of youth homelessness with the dedication it really needs. Without that, I suspect gay organisations would be more responsive than they have been, but i think they really need to get over it.
Matthew S

Which leads to an additional question: Are the NYC homeless indigenous or transient? If, as Sam suggests, the homeless are being drawn to NYC from afar, it rather argues against the idea that homosexuals are overrepresented among the homeless ranks. If instead the homeless are indeed from the NYC area, it would seem to support such an idea. 
 
 The same study indicated that 75% of homeless are minority. The same question then would apply. Are these minorities drawn to NYC for opportunity? 
 
 26% of homeless are veterans. Are veterans being drawn to NYC by the same magnet of opportunity? 
 
 Clearly more study is needed in the migratory habits of Urban Outdoorsmen before broader conclusions can be drawn. Fascinating. Thesis anyone?

 Obviously, it's a good idea to remind parents that it's not a "good" thing to drive their kids out of the home...
 Don't you think?
 
 What's so controversial about that?
 It's a no-brainer.
 
 It's obvious that we can take actions to combat a wide variety of the REAL REASONS for why gay kids leave home at a disproportionate rate as compared to their straight peers.
 What's so difficult about that?
 
 
 
In the absence of additional research, assume worst case scenario. What is your proposed solution?

 Have the "anti-gay" groups show some "Christianity", if it's in them.
 Make a point of telling them that if they DO have a gay kid, that it's equally a sin to drive their kid away from the home. 
 While they may not "accept" the situation, there are obviously compromises which can be found which don't lead to the kid being driven away.
 
 
 And going a step further, your response is lacking in one glaring regard...
 You criticize my conclusion, but you offer no other potential alternative.
 Just insisting that we do "further research", while you show no clue as to what other viable alternatives exist?
 
 You insist on "further research", but you fail to even really attempt to grasp the EXISTING research.
E Mutz

Nobody is claiming that ALL of gay kids are made homeless.
 
 THINK.
 There is no contradiction there.
 Obviously kids who have parents who don't reject them won't wind up homeless... 
 
 Quote:
 Originally Posted by E Mutz 
 Parents of gay children kick their gay child out of the home.[/b] Seems that some do, some don't. Again, no one catch-all explanation.
 Again, NOBODY is claiming that ALL gay kids are made homeless.
 SOME gay kids are homeless.
 SOME gay kids are not.
 
 Do you understand anything about Venn diagrams?

 
 Dude. Now you have split your quote in half and attributed half of it to me. The original quote (in bold below) is yours from post 27.
 
 unless my quick review of the posts missed something, the answer is uncontested. 
 
 Parents of gay children kick their gay child out of the home.
 
 These were your words (Post 27) between the second and third clever little head bashing images. Therein you assign blame to the parents for "kicking the gay child out of the home." This is your diagnosis. If you wish to amend your assertion to include other possibilities for the child's homlessness you would essentially find yourself agreeing with me that this sucks but there is no one root cause and no sweeping cure. 
 
 
 
Ahhh. The obfuscation continues.
 1/4 are FORCED to leave due to conflicts.
 How many leave, but are not FORCED???
 Are there other ways to cause a kid to run away, yet not be KICKED out of the home?
 
 Suppose a parent insists on grounding the kid until he is straight. Or submitting him to "reparative therapy" which tells the kid that the *therapist* would rather see the kid dead than continue to be gay.
 
 Not *forced* to run away, but obviously running away because of the parents' prejudice...

 
 There you have it! Parental prejudice is the only reason for homelessness (at least among homosexual yutes). To argue against this would only be...obfuscation.
 
 
You ever have a hacking cough?
 Do you bother to figure out if it's a cold, or a sinus infection, or the flu, or ...
 ... before you take some medicine to combat the hacking cough?
 Do you insist on figuring out who gave you the cold before you take any medicine for it?
 
 Obviously, it's a good idea to remind parents that it's not a "good" thing to drive their kids out of the home...
 Don't you think?
 
 What's so controversial about that?
 It's a no-brainer.
 
 It's obvious that we can take actions to combat a wide variety of the REAL REASONS for why gay kids leave home at a disproportionate rate as compared to their straight peers.
 What's so difficult about that?

 
 Ever have "flu like symptoms"? "Flu-like symptoms run the gamut from flu to spinal meningitis. You have diagnosed meningitis. I merely note the possibility of flu. Your metaphor, my obfuscation no doubt. 
 
 
And going a step further, your response is lacking in one glaring regard...
 You criticize my conclusion, but you offer no other potential alternative.
 Just insisting that we do "further research", while you show no clue as to what other viable alternatives exist?
 
 You insist on "further research", but you fail to even really attempt to grasp the EXISTING research.

 
 ??? I criticize your conclusions specifically because of the possibility for other explanations which you refuse to consider. 
 
 Clearly I misjudged your purpose in starting this discussion. I thought that you were delving into the hows and whys. Rather, you had your answer and merely wanted to make hay out of any disagreement. 
 
 Lets start the thread over shall we, see how far you advance this without my assistance:
 
 Post one: LBGT Yutes represent a disproportionate percentage of homeless.
 
 Response: Bummer.
 
 Take it from there.
foundit66

Dude. Now you have split your quote in half and attributed half of it to me.

 I have done nothing of the sort.
 You are confusing yourself.
 
 
 
The original quote (in bold below) is yours from post 27.
 
 unless my quick review of the posts missed something, the answer is uncontested. 
 
 Parents of gay children kick their gay child out of the home.
 
 These were your words (Post 27) between the second and third clever little head bashing images. Therein you assign blame to the parents for "kicking the gay child out of the home." This is your diagnosis. If you wish to amend your assertion to include other possibilities for the child's homlessness you would essentially find yourself agreeing with me that this sucks but there is no one root cause and no sweeping cure. 

 I never claimed there was "one root cause".
 You assume WAYYYY too much and read into things which are not there.
 
 Logically, BOTH gay and straight kids can be homeless. TWO-THIRDS of homeless youths are straight, right?
 The point is what is the reason for the DISPROPORTIONATE REPRESENTATION of the gay youths, since gays represent only about 5%. Not 33%.
 
 So logically, if you exclude the GENERIC reasons that afflict all kids for being homeless, you are left wondering where the 33-5% extra (crude math, but approximate) comes from.
 
 THAT is the point.
 
 
 
There you have it! Parental prejudice is the only reason for homelessness (at least among homosexual yutes). To argue against this would only be...obfuscation.

 And on and on you go misrepresenting things.
 I never claimed that.
 I am talking about the reason for the DISPROPORTIONATE representation.
 
 Can you quote me as saying ONLY REASON???
 Then quit LYING in claiming that is what I am saying. emoticon_rolleyes 
 
 
 
Ever have "flu like symptoms"? "Flu-like symptoms run the gamut from flu to spinal meningitis. You have diagnosed meningitis. I merely note the possibility of flu. Your metaphor, my obfuscation no doubt.

 You are trying to take my metaphor, ignore its point, and apply it in a nonsensical way that has lost meaning in the context of things.
 
 If I have "diagnosed meningitis", then it behooves you to explain WHY my diagnosis is wrong.
 You talk about "noting the possibility of flu", but that's false as well.
 You have NOT GIVEN ANY alternative "possibility" for why there is a disproportionate gay presence, have you.
 You only scoff at the idea that I talk about, and prove through a variety of resources.
 
 So, I'll ask you again.
 WHAT ALTERNATIVE REASON do you propose for why there is a DISPROPORTIONATE presence of gays in the homeless youth population???
 
 
 
??? I criticize your conclusions specifically because of the possibility for other explanations which you refuse to consider. 

 What "other explanations" have I supposedly "refused to consider"?
 What "other explanations" are there for why there is a disproportionate gay presence in the homeless youth population.
 Please. Be explicit.
 
 Over and over again, you make false claims, misrepresent my ACTUAL statements, and thoroughly confuse yourself on things.
 You pretend you have made counter-explanations when the truth is that you have not.
 
 So, instead of your snide antics, how about YOU ACTUALLY GIVE alternatives that you claim I am supposedly ignoring???
E Mutz

I have done nothing of the sort.
 You are confusing yourself.
 
 Quote:
 Originally Posted by E Mutz 
 The original quote (in bold below) is yours from post 27.
 
 unless my quick review of the posts missed something, the answer is uncontested. 
 
 Parents of gay children kick their gay child out of the home.

 First you deny it then you reprint it. That's Chutzpah.
 
 
I never claimed there was "one root cause".
 You assume WAYYYY too much and read into things which are not there.

 
 Deny it, reprint it, deny it. That's Clintonian.
 
 
The point is what is the reason for the DISPROPORTIONATE REPRESENTATION of the gay youths, since gays represent only about 5%. Not 33%.
 
 So logically, if you exclude the GENERIC reasons that afflict all kids for being homeless, you are left wondering where the 33-5% extra (crude math, but approximate) comes from.
 
 THAT is the point.

 
 Indeed. One that I have repeatedly noted needs additional research as part of a larger issue on homeless trends. 
 
 
And on and on you go misrepresenting things.
 I never claimed that.
 I am talking about the reason for the DISPROPORTIONATE representation.
 
 Can you quote me as saying ONLY REASON???
 Then quit LYING in claiming that is what I am saying.

 
 Deny it, reprint it, deny it, claim misrepresentation. If you want to renounce your earlier claim that is for you to do not I.
 
 
If I have "diagnosed meningitis", then it behooves you to explain WHY my diagnosis is wrong.
 You talk about "noting the possibility of flu", but that's false as well.
 You have NOT GIVEN ANY alternative "possibility" for why there is a disproportionate gay presence, have you.
 You only scoff at the idea that I talk about, and prove through a variety of resources.

 
 I have told you that your diagnosis may be flawed and suggested that you run some tests Doctor. You have demonstrated that there are multiple factors at work. Your own data suggests no more than half of LBGT yutes are kicked out of the house. In absence of data you blame parental factors for the other 50%. Moreover, you have dismissed any questioning of whether the homeless population in NYC is statistically skewed by the influx of out-of-state (transient population). You dismiss this as obfuscation when it is a legitimate question that goes to the heart of the disproportionality that you have harped. The study after all is of homeless yutes in NYC, not Des Moines Iowa. Perhaps NYC draws a disproportionate number of homosexual homeless who are seeking acceptance. 
 
 
So, I'll ask you again.
 WHAT ALTERNATIVE REASON do you propose for why there is a DISPROPORTIONATE presence of gays in the homeless youth population???

 
 I'll say it again in bold this time I don't know, you clearly don't know that is why we need more research.
foundit66

First you deny it then you reprint it. That's Chutzpah.

 You're going to have to actually EXPLAIN what you think you're talking about.
 Use more than one sentence please. And try to be explicit in doing it and none of this vague claim nonsense.
 
 You are obviously interpreting my words in a way that is inconsistent with what I am actually saying, and it is impossible to clear up your confusion when all you do is accuse without listing out EXPLICITLY the details of my supposed offense.
 
 
 
Indeed. One that I have repeatedly noted needs additional research as part of a larger issue on homeless trends.

 Yes. So you have.
 And in doing so, you have completely failed to look at EXISTING research, or to look at obvious solutions to obvious problems demonstrated in EXISTING research.
 
 It's like having flooding on a boat. ONE source is ABSOLUTELY and POSITIVELY identified. Undeniable, as you don't even try to deny that parents sometimes kick their gay child out of the home, and sometimes they drive him out.
 But instead of fighting this one source that is POSITIVELY identified, you insist that an inspection of the rest of the boat be done to identify any other possible sources.
 Failing to note the obvious and logical solution. FIGHT the flooding that is identified, while continuing to investigate the rest of the boat.
 
 
 
Deny it, reprint it, deny it, claim misrepresentation. If you want to renounce your earlier claim that is for you to do not I.

 At this stage, I have to wonder if anybody can take you seriously.
 I have asked you quite simply to QUOTE me in what I am supposedly saying which supposedly solidifies your accusation.
 You repeatedly fail to do that, continuing to simply claim that I am continuing to give you evidence while failing to identify what you think is evidence.
 
 You're like a child complaining that dogs are everywhere, but only after calming the hysterical child can the parent figure out that the child has inaccurately labelled a "wall" as a "dog"...
 
 
 
I have told you that your diagnosis may be flawed and suggested that you run some tests Doctor.

 ROFLMAO!
 "may be flawed"...
 You continue to fail to point out ANY REASON WHY my diagnosis is flawed.
 I have no problem with "other tests", but the EXISTING tests show that some suitable action should be taken.
 So why the heck aren't you onboard with actually TAKING that action?
 
 
 
You have demonstrated that there are multiple factors at work. Your own data suggests no more than half of LBGT yutes are kicked out of the house.

 This is further example of your reading comprehension.
 (And, quite frankly, if what you said WERE actually true, a RATIONAL response {which you are not having} would be one of shock and awe and automatic insistence on addressing the IDENTIFIED problem.)
 
 The data stated that half of LGBT youths are REJECTED by their parents.
 Doesn't mean they are kicked out of the home.
 
 Furthermore, you are repeating the same mistake you failed to recognize in yourself earlier.
 
 Suppose we had 100 LGBT youths.
 50 of those, as you put it, are kicked out of the home.
 That makes 50 homeless gay youths.
 And doing the math, that means 100 homeless straight youths.
 
 Where is the inconsistency?
 You lack the mathematical fundamentals to comprehend Venn diagrams and how sub-groups do and do not interact.
 
 
 
In absence of data you blame parental factors for the other 50%.

 "other 50%" of what???
 My gawd man. READ and COMPREHEND.
 The original statistic was that out of ALL LGBT youths, 50% are rejected by the parents.
 That doesn't mean all HOMELESS lgbt youths, which would be an entirely different sub-section.
 
 You keep flying off the handle, misunderstanding what is clearly stated in English, and applying red and box together to get 4.
 
 
 
Moreover, you have dismissed any questioning of whether the homeless population in NYC is statistically skewed by the influx of out-of-state (transient population).

 That's a downright lie.
 Show me the post where I did that.
 How can I "dismiss" something that you have never even broached to me???
 
 
 
I'll say it again in bold this time I don't know, you clearly don't know that is why we need more research.

 YOU don't know, even though existing research has been shown to you.
 WHY is this so difficult for you?
 
 ONE source has been POSITIVELY identified.
 But you refuse to endorse any action upon that one problem source until "further research".
 Can you explain why we shouldn't endorse action upon the EXISTING problem source that has been UNREFUTABLY identified while we wait on your "further research"???
foundit66

50% of all gay and lesbian youth report that their parents reject them due to their sexual orientation. (2) 
 26% of gay and lesbian youth are forced to leave home because of conflicts over their sexual orientation. (1) 
 In a study of 194 gay and lesbian youth, 25% were verbally abused by parents, and nearly 10% dealt with threatened or actual violence. (12) 
 http://www.pflagphoenix.org/education/youth_stats.html
 
 
 (Just out of curiousity Mutz, do you include the word "gay" at all in your search queries when you try to find info about this topic on the GAY rights section???)

 
 To repeat because some people obviously didn't understand it the first time, the first statistic (bold-red) talks about all gay YOUTHS.
 Not all HOMELESS gay youths.
 
 The first statistic can obviously infer a sense of what the gay youths face at home, which helps demonstrate the environment they are in BEFORE they become homeless.
 
 Mutz is messing this up (amongst many other things) in thinking that statistic is talking about 50% of gay HOMELESS youths, which it is not.
 
 Also, it states 26% of gay YOUTHS are forced to leave their homes.
 It doesn't say that 26% of gay HOMELESS youths were forced to leave their homes.
 (And in all honesty, I missed that earlier...)
 Just because 26% of gay YOUTHS are forced to leave their homes doesn't mean that 26% of gay HOMELESS youths were forced to leave their homes. It could be that 95% of this gay homeless youth sub-section WERE forced to leave their homes.
 
 Also, considering the info above, what more "study" needs to be done on this IDENTIFIED cause of gay homelessness?
 Do we need to sub-categorize every class of homeless gay youths before we can endorse action on even ONE cause of homelessness in gay youths???
 
 
 Furthermore, don't think I didn't notice that you avoided my question Mutz.
 (Just out of curiousity Mutz, do you include the word "gay" at all in your search queries when you try to find info about this topic on the GAY rights section???)
 
 I'll take your silence to demonstrate that you didn't include the word "gay" in any of your efforts to actually look for EXISTING research on the issue of homeless gay youths...
Scottd
